definition: to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
disgrace/dishonor/to insult/to bring disgrace or humiliation to/to be indebted to/self-deprecating/Taiwan pr. [ru4]

sentences.english: This abdication of the treaty, the representative of China even prepared to recognize the signature.
sentences.chinese: 對這喪權辱國的條約，中國代表居然準備簽字承認。

sentences.english: This humiliating treaty, China was ready to acknowledge signatures.
sentences.chinese: 對這喪權辱國的條約，中國代表居然準備簽字承認。

definition: Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
Fabi, first currency issued by the 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] in 1935, in use until 1948
